message.content: One of the most significant events that happened in Croatia in the past 20 years is its accession to the European Union (EU) on July 1, 2013. This event marked an important milestone in the country's history, as Croatia became the 28th member state of the EU. The accession process involved comprehensive reforms and negotiations, aiming to align Croatia's legal framework, economy, and governance with EU standards. It signaled Croatia's integration into the wider European community, offering new opportunities and benefits while also posing challenges. Croatia's EU accession has had a profound impact on the country's economy, politics, and society, shaping its trajectory in the 21st century.
